content: Is there a method to convert content from one type to another? Ideally using checkboxes on the content admin page to do it for multiple items at once?
In Drupal I think https://www.drupal.org/project/node_convert is a good option but I don't think it's been ported yet.
If there's no method currently I may port that.
I don't think I've ever done that in either Drupal or Backdrop.

It's one of those things that's really useful once in a while. Especially when redoing a site and perhaps getting rid of some content types -- to preserve certain content before you delete the content type.
Ugh. Ctools again. That'll slow that idea right down.

@Laryn the only modules I'm aware of are https://www.drupal.org/project/node_convert (D7) and https://www.drupal.org/project/convert_bundles (D8) ...in the early days, if node_convert would fail, people would use Feeds to "move" content from one type to another.

Thanks, I may end up doing it with feeds. Sometimes if it's not much more work to port a module that would make it simpler for others down the road I try to work that in, but the ctools stuff really slows me down on porting...
I'll never understand why ctools is not in Drupal core. Almost every site uses a module that requires it.
